problem_text:
Suppose that a countable locally finite group G contains no proper subgroups isomorphic to G itself and suppose that all Sylow subgroups of G are finite. Does G possess a non-trivial finite normal subgroup?
V. V. Belyaev
answer: Yes, it does (S. D. Bell, Locally finite groups with ˇCernikov Sylow subgroups, (Ph. D. Thesis), University of Manchester, 1994).
